text: hi this is Seema and today i will be

we had more well there are lots of
expressions and idioms related to time
so here we are going to check out a few
so we do them real quick ok because we
have no time to lose the first one is in
the nick of time well once this phrase
mean in the nick of time is nothing but
doing or finishing something at the last
possible moment so for example you know
you were arriving for your exams which
must have begun say at around 9 o'clock
in the morning and you arrived at just
8:15 9 you know you're like in the nick
of time because you arrived or you did
something at the last possible moment
otherwise you would have been late so in
the nick of time is arriving at the last
possible moment
moving on to turn back the hands of time
well have you seen a clock yeah most of

you know moves the hands of the clock
always move in the right direction if I
had to turn back the hands of time I
would literally have to you know reverse
the movement of the hands of the clock
sort of so turning back the hands of
time is nothing but indicating a desire
to go back to the past a desire to visit
your past
well this expression is mainly used in
regret it is mainly used when you're
kind of longing for something that was
you know way back in the past but you
don't have it anymore so I could say I
wish I could turn back the hands of time
and visit my childhood because childhood
is something that we all love or I could
say that I wish I could turn back the
hands of time and you know I have done
things differently because we've all
made a lot of mistakes so turning back
the hands of time indicates a desire to
visit the past and it normally is used
when you kind of regret your past
actions okay moving on to time flies
what is time flies mean well time does
not literally fly but time flies means
that time passes too quickly doesn't it
ever annoy you that you know whenever
you are having a good time you're here
you're the fun place or just you know
going for a party you know the time just
goes by and you don't know when it's

time flies when time passes quickly
which which happens mostly in good you
know good times that's when you use this
this phrase moving on to save time we
all have heard about saving money saving

doing things are in a quicker way in a

know cutting on your time so well
suppose I walk to school every day and a
certain route that takes me to school
takes 40 minutes but if I want to save

do things
or I walk the same you know on the same
to the same place but I do it in a much

spare time what is spare time means
spare time is nothing but free time so
spare time or free time as we call it is

so it is mainly time used for you know
recreational purposes or time to pursue

or in my spare time I learn French or in

during my spare time I don't go to work
I don't study I don't I don't feed the
children I do what I want to do so it's

it's my free time it's me time alright
moving on - as time goes by well this is

with the passage of time people tend to
change or with the passage of time
children tend to get naughty ah so

that is quickly moving and you're kind
of talking about the changes involved
when the time goes by well let's look at
a time for a change time for a change is
nothing but time to start something new
so you're looking to start something
completely different
so basically this phrase indicates that
you want to stop what you were doing all
this while and now it is time for a
change so maybe you were working in a
job for say like five years
you're totally stressed you're burnt out
and now you decide that it is time to

you may say something like it's time for
a change let me get a new job okay
moving on to time is money time is money
indicates that time is a very valuable

time is money it's very valuable to me
moving on to time heals all wounds
well the wounds in this phrase refers to
emotional hurt and not the physical ones
so time heals all wounds indicates that
you know time he raises or removes

sometimes you know when people go
through a lot of hardship in life and
they have a lot of problems you know you

so basically we're referring to
emotional hurts
pain struggles and not physical wounds
moving on - only time will tell
well sometimes you know we're not sure

happen in the future
so only with the passage of time will we
know what's going to happen and that is

an idea or truth that is going to take
place in the future and that is when I
use the terminology only time will tell
this terminology is basically used when
you are uncertain about a certain thing
that's going to happen moving on to a
whale of a time a whale of a time is

to a hard time well a hard time is

it's hardships struggles suffering

through a hard time so when you know
when we have emotional problems or when
we have you know a sudden demise in the

a breakup in relationships we talk about
having a hard time because we're unable

time means it is hardships sufferings
and problems well that's it for the
